data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.8.1, 1.9-insider Steps to Reproduce: 1. using the extension explorer, open some extension that has an anchor link in its readme: bla`. The Java extension is a good example 2. Click on this link **Expected** Navigates down page to link **Actual** Opens `webview.html` in the editor: ![jan-12-2017 18-39-43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/21916639/c787de74-d8f6-11e6-9a5a-4c93771f0214.gif)

data.title: API for extensions to know the scope as per grammar of the cursor position
data.body:
It would be helpful for extension authors to know if the cursor is inside a string or a comment or any of the other scopes as defined by the grammar.

When an extension is not using LSP, this can help the extension in being smarter say in case of completion item provider.
Currently to do so, the extension needs to parse the file itself.
But, the scope (as per grammar) is already available to core VS Code.

If that can be exposed, I can fix a bunch of issues in the Go extension :)

data.title: Add peek implemenation command
data.body: Fixes #18481

data.title: References Window Immediately Dismissed When Selecting Peek Definition From Command Pallet
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Mac 10.11.6 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create ts file:

```ts
function abc() { };
abc()
```

2. Put selection on last line in `abc`
3. From command pallet, run `peek definition`.
4. Select the `peek definition` command with <kbd>enter</kbd>, but hold the enter key a moment.

**Expected Behavior**
Peek is shown. Enter key must be pressed again to navigate to a reference

**Actual behavior**
If the enter key is pressed when the references window shows, we navigate to that reference. This ends up causing the references window to flash quickly and then be dismissed:

![jan-12-2017 18-15-15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/21916111/17dbecca-d8f3-11e6-9bb1-797c247abfb7.gif)

You have to be very quick when pressing  <kbd>enter</kbd> to accept the `peek definition` command from the command pallet to avoid this.

data.title: Add Peek Implementation Command
data.body:
Follow up on #10806

 #18346 added a `go to implementation` command that languages can implement. To match the current `go to definition` experience, we also likely want to have a `peek implementation` command that expands the implementations without changing the current location

data.title: Fix 17584
data.body:
Fixes #17584

Uses commit characters to ensure we only enable dot completions when the previous character is a valid identifier.

This is a workaround for https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/13456

data.title: Ctrl-Shift-B does not correctly detect when a process exits when sub-processes are started.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch build task A.exe (Ctrl-Shift-B)
2. A.exe launches B.exe, then quits.
3. Try to build again (Ctrl-Shift-B)
4. Get "there is an active task running right now"
5. Press "terminate".
6. Get error "the launched task doesn't exist anymore"
7. Be stuck in loop 3..6 until you quit and restart VSCode, or manually quit the unrelated B.exe.

Here, B.exe is a deamon process needing to be active for all runs of A.exe, which gets started on first run of A.exe. Quitting B.exe on each run is unpractical.

data.title: [vb] Switch to a more active grammar for VB

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 14393.577

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a modern VB.NET file, such as [VBEditAndContinueAnalyzer](https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn/blob/0694d5ccc05b7e1cc37c82a1c15c8f9fc23e3775/src/Features/VisualBasic/Portable/EditAndContinue/VisualBasicEditAndContinueAnalyzer.vb)
2. Observe that 'Imports', 'Namespace', 'Friend', 'Inherits', 'Protected', 'Override', and perhaps other keywords are not colorized, but simply appear as white text.

This same issue repros with the same grammar on:

- TextMate editor for Mac
- VS Code for Windows
- Visual Studio 2017 RC

I am fairly certain that this is a TMLanguages issue, as doing a quick search through the [grammar file](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/extensions/vb/syntaxes/ASPVBnet.plist), there is no pattern for matching these keywords.

I'd recommend either switching to an alternative grammar, such as [Angry Ant's](https://github.com/angryant0007/VBDotNetSyntax), or better yet, updating and contributing the corrected grammar file back to [the TextMate Grammar](https://github.com/textmate/asp.vb.net.tmbundle).

data.title: Add onDidChangeModelMarkers to IEditor interface
data.body:
Similar methods such as setModelLanguage have emitters:

[setModelLanguage](https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/api/modules/monaco.editor.html#setmodellanguage)
[onDidChangeModelLanguage](https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/api/modules/monaco.editor.html#ondidchangemodellanguage)

It would be useful to have the same for modelMarkers:

[setModelMarkers](https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/api/modules/monaco.editor.html#setmodelmarkers)
onDidChangeModelMarkers

data.title: does not list `trait construct and symbols in php`
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: current-last available
- OS Version: Mac El capitan

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a simple text file
2. add <?
3. declare two empty trait interfaces

```
trait foo { /**/ }
trait bar { /**/ }
```
4. to solve listing symbols inside. 

(should be the same grouping rule than a `class` keyword without the need of  matching `extras` after and before the identifier i.e [abstract, final, extends, implements], something like `interface` but with the same body than a `class` container)

data.title: Encryption code-compilation process?
data.body:
Hi,
I have a small problem, I am developing in C# (VS2015) and I thought that when compiling the program I was sure all my algorithms and codes were safe, but I used the first internet decopile tool (ILSpy) and I discovered it is very easy for anyone to copy my code.
Questions:
1.	If I Buy VS professional, it is the compilation process safer?
2.	Someone can recommend some obfuscator for C# that is not so expensive?

Thanks in advance, 
Ricardo

data.title: Visual Studio Code takes forever to start and then runs incredibly slowly

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.6.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.3|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.7.2|

---
See screenshots for hung application load.  Blank Visual Code window and three Visual Studio Code processes running - one using all processor time.  It takes about 3-5 minutes to load.  Once it loads, clicking on a directory produces the same sequence - 2-5 mins to load - see last screen shot.

Steps to Reproduce:

Same installation runs on other computers - my Windows 10 desktop and Windows 10 Surface Pro 3.
The system is my new dev system. Its a Windows 10 Pro Virtual Machine - running on a Windows Server 2016 host in HyperV.

I've uninstalled Code  and re-installed from the Web.  Same result.

data.title: PSScriptAnalzyer corrupts multi-line code during replace-aliases
data.body:
Platform
Win7 x64
![pic4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9885921/21896501/887754d4-d8de-11e6-89ba-f74239da5b48.jpg)

To replicate (note use of backtick to split line)

    $Pools = gwmi -query "select * from IIsApplicationPoolSetting" -computer $server `
       -namespace "root\microsoftiisv2" -Authentication PacketPrivacy -erroraction SilentlyContinue


PSScriptAnalyzer pulled that up at gwmi being an alias, so I hit the lightbulb to convert it to Get-WMIObject. This happened.

    $Pools = Get-WmiObjectroot\microsoftiisv2" -Authentication PacketPrivacy -erroraction SilentlyContinue

As you can see, it cut out a heap of code and merged the two lines.

![pic1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9885921/21896498/886096f4-d8de-11e6-9032-89c6b47dec08.jpg)
![pic2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9885921/21896500/886f8b1e-d8de-11e6-8d33-3ca7b9ba239c.jpg)
![pic3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9885921/21896499/8863ee9e-d8de-11e6-9bec-88ad36bffc96.jpg)

data.title: Status bar priority should apply reverse for alignment LEFT

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: To get an item to the right most side of that status bar I set its alignment to `Right` and its priority to `Number.MAX_VALUE`. Now to get an item to left of side I have to use alignment `Left` and *not* `Number.MIN_VALUE` but again `Number.MAX_VALUE` which is against any of my order senses.
